byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: IN the midst of the interminable and all-absorbing discussions of such great world issues as the war debts, Manchuria and disarmament, Secretary Stimson and the Ambassadors of half a dozen great powers have turned their attention to a plea of...
docs.lead_paragraph: IN the midst of the interminable and all-absorbing discussions of such great world issues as the war debts, Manchuria and disarmament, Secretary Stimson and the Ambassadors of half a dozen great powers have turned their attention to a plea of Colombia for support in resisting an alleged aggression by Peru against Colombian territory.

headline.main: TWO THREATS TO PEACE DRAW ATTENTION TO SOUTH AMERICA; Both the Leticia and Chaco Disputes, Which Have Led to Outside Attempts at Mediation, Began in Vague Boundaries

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 29 -- It is understood in usually well informed circles that the Argentine and Chilean Foreign Ministers, when they meet in Mendoza, Argentina, Wednesday, will study a plan for settlement of the Leticia, Chaco and other South...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 29 -- It is understood in usually well informed circles that the Argentine and Chilean Foreign Ministers, when they meet in Mendoza, Argentina, Wednesday, will study a plan for settlement of the Leticia, Chaco and other South American conflicts in South America, without the intervention of the United States or other outside nations.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: SOUTHERLAND DIES; WAS REAR ADMIRAL; Commander-in-Chief of the Pacific Fleet for 2 Years Before World War. SERVED ON SAILING SHIPS Captured Three Vessels In Span- ish-American WaruRetired While on Navy's General Board.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PARIS, Jan. 31 -- Apparently spurred on by the possibility that the Davis Cup may be wrested from France, where it has been held for six years, the record-equaling total of thirty-three nations today was entered for the 1933 international tennis...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Jan. 31 -- Apparently spurred on by the possibility that the Davis Cup may be wrested from France, where it has been held for six years, the record-equaling total of thirty-three nations today was entered for the 1933 international tennis play.

headline.main: 33 NATIONS ENTER DAVIS CUP NET PLAY; Total of Teams to Compete in 1933 Event Equals Record Set in 1928. THREE MORE THAN IN 1932 South Africa, Argentina and Peru New Challengers -- 24 in European Zone. UNITED STATES FAVORED Famous Trophy Has Remained in France for 6 Years -- Australia Looms as Formidable.

docs.snippet: Spanish Min to Uruguay signs new treaty
docs.abstract: Spanish Min to Uruguay signs new treaty

headline.main: Spain to Buy Uruguayan Beef In Return for Tariff Benefits

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 -- A large audience attended this morning the last of the season's series of musicales given at the Mayflower by Mrs. Lawrence Townsend.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 -- A large audience attended this morning the last of the season's series of musicales given at the Mayflower by Mrs. Lawrence Townsend.

headline.main: OPERA STARS HEARD IN CAPITAL CONCERT; Program Given by Mme. Lotte Lehmann and Paolo Marion Ends Morning Series.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PARIS, Feb. 2. -- The United States will start its Davis Cup play this year on June 13 against Mexico as a result of today's draw at the Presidential Palace.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Feb. 2. -- The United States will start its Davis Cup play this year on June 13 against Mexico as a result of today's draw at the Presidential Palace.

headline.main: U.S. WILL OPPOSE MEXICO AT TENNIS Borotra, Cochet and Brugnon Watch as Arrangements Are Made for 33 Challengers.; Davis Cup Teams Drawn at Paris to Play North Amer- ican Zone Match June 13. CANADA AND CUBA PAIRED American Ambassador Present as Lebrun Picks First Card From Famous Trophy. THREE DEFENDERS ATTEND

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2. -- United States exports during December were larger to twenty-one principal foreign markets and declined to the remaining nineteen, while imports were less than for the preceding month from twenty-one countries and larger from...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2. -- United States exports during December were larger to twenty-one principal foreign markets and declined to the remaining nineteen, while imports were less than for the preceding month from twenty-one countries and larger from nineteen, according to detailed foreign trade figures issued today by the Department of Commerce.

headline.main: DECEMBER EXPORT MADE SOME GAINS; We Sold More to 21 Countries Than in November, Although Total Was $7,493,747 Less. YEAR'S DECLINES GENERAL Only Two Countries, Brazil and Greece, Bought More Here in 1932 Than in 1931.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 -- The announcement of Foreign Minister Saavedra Lamas in Buenos Aires of the formation of an ABC-Peru group claiming executive jurisdiction over the Chaco controversy between Bolivia and Paraguay and future South American...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 -- The announcement of Foreign Minister Saavedra Lamas in Buenos Aires of the formation of an ABC-Peru group claiming executive jurisdiction over the Chaco controversy between Bolivia and Paraguay and future South American conflicts, without the assistance of the United States, aroused no objection in official circles here, judging from reactions today to the Buenos Aires reports in THE NEW YORK TIMES.

headline.main: ABC-PERU ACTION NOT OPPOSED BY US; Washington Seems to Welcome Plan of South America to Settle Own Affairs. DOCTRINE NOT INVOLVED Monroe Principles, It Is Held, Do Not Bar Such a Move by Latin Countries. CHILE SEES CHACO PEACE Argentine Foreign Minister Says International Law Is Needed on Undeclared Wars.
